ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Playing a rogue
ygData.msgSnippet: That s great.  But how does that help me? Wulfric ... From: Kent King To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, March 19, 2003 9:10 PM Subject: Re:
ygData.messageBody:
That's great.  But how does that help me?
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Kent King
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, March 19, 2003 9:10 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Playing a rogue

Welcome to my world.  My main is a 61 monk.
Quwi Changkane, Grandmaster Fenin Ro

--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> Perhaps you people can help me.  This is something
> I've pondered for awhile.
>
> My rogue is level 32.  I play him infrequently.  At
> level 30 rogues get all the skills they are going to
> get.  Rogues are non-casters so they don't have new
> spells to look forward to.  The only things rogues
> have to look forward to are their disciplines at
> level 50.  So how does one get from level 30 to
> level 50 in the shortest amount of time possible?
> Whenever I play, it seems like I always have a hard
> time finding a group.  I'm looking in places like
> Frontier Mountains, The Overthere, and Dawnshroud
> Peaks.  I'm not high enough level that I can easily
> solo any mobs in either of those zones. But nobody
> seems to want to group.  So are there any zones
> where I can get quick xp by soloing?  Or are there
> other zones I could try for groups? 
>
> I hate for my rogue to fall by the way side because
> he's become a bore to play.  So any suggestions you
> have for playing rogue characters to help me out
> would be appreciated.
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Wulfric Rennison
> 32 Half Elf Rogue
> Cazic Thule server
